--ag-alpine-active-color.description: (Alpine theme only) accent colour used for checked checkboxes, range selections, row hover, row selections, selected tab underlines, and input focus outlines in the Alpine theme

--ag-balham-active-color.description: (Balham theme only) accent colour used for checked checkboxes, range selections, row selections, and input focus outlines in the Balham theme

--ag-material-primary-color.description: (Material theme only) the primary colour as defined in the [Material Design colour system](https://material.io/design/color/). Currently this is used on buttons, range selections and selected tab underlines in the Material theme

--ag-material-accent-color.description: (Material theme only) the accent colour as defined in the [Material Design colour system](https://material.io/design/color/). Currently this is used on checked checkboxes in the Material theme

--ag-foreground-color.description: Colour of text and icons in primary UI elements like menus

--ag-secondary-foreground-color.description: Colour of text and icons in UI elements that need to be slightly less emphasised to avoid distracting attention from data

--ag-data-color.description: Colour of text in grid cells

--ag-header-foreground-color.description: Colour of text and icons in the header

--ag-header-background-color.description: Background colour for all headers, including the grid header, panels etc

--ag-disabled-foreground-color.description: Color of elements that can't be interacted with because they are in a disabled state

--ag-subheader-background-color.description: Background colour for second level headings within UI components

--ag-subheader-toolbar-background-color.description: Background colour for toolbars directly under subheadings (as used in the chart settings menu)

--ag-control-panel-background-color.description: Background for areas of the interface that contain UI controls, like tool panels and the chart settings menu

--ag-side-button-selected-background-col.description: Background for the active tab on the side of the control panel

--ag-selected-row-background-color.description: Background color of selected rows in the grid and in dropdown menus

--ag-odd-row-background-color.description: Background colour applied to every other row

--ag-modal-overlay-background-color.description: Background color of the overlay shown over the grid e.g. a data loading indicator

--ag-row-hover-color.description: Background color when hovering over rows in the grid and in dropdown menus. Set to `transparent` to disable the hover effect. Note: if you want a rollover on one but not the other, use CSS selectors instead of this property

--ag-column-hover-color.description: Background color when hovering over columns in the grid

--ag-range-selection-border-color.description: Color to draw around selected cell ranges

--ag-range-selection-border-style.description: Border style for range selections, e.g. `solid` or `dashed`. Do not set to `none`, if you need to hide the border set the color to transparent

--ag-range-selection-background-color.description: Background colour of selected cell ranges.

--ag-range-selection-background-color-2.description: Background-color when 2 selected ranges overlap. Hint: for a realistic appearance of multiple semi-transparent colours overlaying, set the opacity to 1-((1-X)^2) where X is the opacity of --ag-range-selection-background-color

--ag-range-selection-background-color-3.description: Background-color when 3 selected ranges overlap. Hint: for a realistic appearance of multiple semi-transparent colours overlaying, set the opacity to 1-((1-X)^3) where X is the opacity of --ag-range-selection-background-color

--ag-range-selection-background-color-4.description: Background-color when 4 or more selected ranges overlap. Hint: for a realistic appearance of multiple semi-transparent colours overlaying, set the opacity to 1-((1-X)^4) where X is the opacity of --ag-range-selection-background-color

--ag-range-selection-highlight-color.description: Background colour to briefly apply to a cell range when it is copied from or pasted into

--ag-selected-tab-underline-color.description: Colour of the border drawn under selected tabs

--ag-selected-tab-underline-width.description: Thickness of the border drawn under selected tabs

--ag-selected-tab-underline-transition-s.description: Duration of animation used to show and hide the border drawn under selected tabs

--ag-range-selection-chart-category-back.description: Background colour for cells that provide categories to the current range chart

--ag-range-selection-chart-background-co.description: Background colour for cells that provide data to the current range chart

--ag-header-cell-hover-background-color.description: Rollover colour for header cells. If you set this variable and have enabled column reordering by dragging, you may want to set `--ag-header-cell-moving-background-color` to ensure that the rollover colour remains in place during dragging.

--ag-header-cell-moving-background-color.description: Colour applied to header cells when the column is being dragged to a new position

--ag-value-change-value-highlight-backgr.description: Colour to apply when a cell value changes and enableCellChangeFlash is enabled

--ag-value-change-delta-up-color.description: Colour to temporarily apply to cell data when its value increases in an agAnimateShowChangeCellRenderer cell

--ag-value-change-delta-down-color.description: Colour to temporarily apply to cell data when its value decreases in an agAnimateShowChangeCellRenderer cell

--ag-chip-background-color.description: Colour for the 'chip' that represents a column that has been dragged onto a drop zone

--ag-borders.description: Enable or disable borders around most UI elements in the grid. Set this to a border style and thickness, e.g. `solid 1px` to enable borders, or `none` to disable borders. Use the other --ag-borders-* variables for more fine grained control over which UI elements get borders.
--ag-borders.type: a CSS border style and size (e.g. `solid 1px` or `none`)

--ag-border-color.description: Colour for border around major UI components like the grid itself, headers; footers and tool panels.

--ag-borders-critical.description: Enable or disable borders that are critical to UX, e.g. those between headers and rows. Themes that disable borders generally may want to enable these borders. Set this to a border style and thickness, e.g. `solid 1px` to enable borders, or `none` to disable borders.
--ag-borders-critical.type: a CSS border style and size (e.g. `solid 1px` or `none`)

--ag-borders-secondary.description: Draw decorative borders separating UI elements within components. Set this to a border style and thickness, e.g. `solid 1px` to enable borders, or `none` to disable borders.
--ag-borders-secondary.type: a CSS border style and size (e.g. `solid 1px` or `none`)

--ag-secondary-border-color.description: Colour for borders used to separate elements within a major UI component

--ag-row-border-style.description: Default border style for the grid rows. Set this to a border style, e.g. `solid`, `dotted`.

--ag-row-border-width.description: The thickness of the border between grid rows. Set this to a border thickness, e.g. `1px`.

--ag-row-border-color.description: Colour of the border between grid rows, or `transparent` to display no border

--ag-cell-horizontal-border.description: Default border for cells. This can be used to specify the border-style and border-color properties e.g. `dashed red` but the border-width is fixed at 1px. Set to `solid transparent` to show no border.
--ag-cell-horizontal-border.type: a CSS border style and colour (e.g. `solid red`)

--ag-borders-input.description: Draw borders around inputs. Set this to a border style and thickness, e.g. `solid 1px` to enable borders, or `none` to disable borders.
--ag-borders-input.type: a CSS border style and size (e.g. `solid 1px` or `none`)

--ag-input-border-color.description: Colour for borders around inputs, if enabled with --ag-borders-input

--ag-borders-input-invalid.description: Draw borders around inputs when their content has failed validation. Set this to a border style and thickness, e.g. `solid 2px` to enable borders. Set to `none` to disable borders but ensure that you have added styles to differentiate invalid from valid inputs.
--ag-borders-input-invalid.type: a CSS border style and size (e.g. `solid 1px` or `none`)

--ag-input-border-color-invalid.description: The color for the border around invalid inputs, if enabled with --ag-borders-input-invalid

--ag-borders-side-button.description: Draw borders around the vertical tabs on the side of the control panel. Set this to a border style and thickness, e.g. `solid 1px` to enable borders, or `none` to disable borders.
--ag-borders-side-button.type: a CSS border style and size (e.g. `solid 1px` or `none`)

--ag-border-radius.description: Border radius applied to many elements such as dialogs and form widgets

--ag-invalid-color.description: The color applied to form elements in an invalid state

--ag-input-disabled-border-color.description: The border around disabled text inputs

--ag-input-disabled-background-color.description: The background colour of disabled text inputs

--ag-checkbox-checked-color.description: color of the `checkbox-checked` icon that is shown in a checked checkbox

--ag-checkbox-unchecked-color.description: color of the `checkbox-unchecked` icon that is shown in an unchecked checkbox

--ag-checkbox-indeterminate-color.description: color of the `checkbox-indeterminate` icon that is shown in an indeterminate checkbox

--ag-toggle-button-border-width.description: size of the toggle button outer border

--ag-toggle-button-on-border-color.description: colour of the toggle button outer border in its 'on' state

--ag-toggle-button-off-border-color.description: colour of the toggle button's outer border in its 'off' state

--ag-toggle-button-on-background-color.description: colour of the toggle button background in its 'on' state

--ag-toggle-button-off-background-color.description: colour of the toggle button background in its 'off' state

--ag-toggle-button-switch-background-col.description: colour of the toggle button switch (the bit that slides from left to right)

--ag-toggle-button-switch-border-color.description: border colour of the toggle button switch (the bit that slides from left to right)

--ag-toggle-button-width.description: width of the whole toggle button component

--ag-toggle-button-height.description: height of the whole toggle button component

--ag-input-focus-border-color.description: Colour of the border around focussed inputs. Set to `var(--ag-input-border-color)` if you do not want to change the border colour on focus.

--ag-minichart-selected-chart-color.description: Color of border around selected chart style

--ag-minichart-selected-page-color.description: Color of dot representing selected page of chart styles

--ag-grid-size.description: grid-size is the main control for affecting how tightly data and UI elements are packed together. All padding and spacing in the grid is defined as a multiple of grid-size, so increasing it will make most components larger by increasing their internal white space while leaving the size of text and icons unchanged.

--ag-icon-size.description: The size of square icons and icon-buttons

--ag-widget-container-horizontal-padding.description: The horizontal padding of containers that contain stacked widgets, such as menus and tool panels

--ag-widget-container-vertical-padding.description: The vertical padding of containers that contain stacked widgets, such as menus and tool panels

--ag-widget-horizontal-spacing.description: The horizontal spacing between widgets in containers that contain horizontally stacked widgets such as the column groups header component.

--ag-widget-vertical-spacing.description: The vertical spacing between widgets in containers that contain vertically stacked widgets

--ag-cell-horizontal-padding.description: Horizontal padding for grid and header cells (vertical padding is not set explicitly, but inferred from row-height / header-height

--ag-cell-widget-spacing.description: Horizontal spacing between widgets inside cells (e.g. row group expand buttons and row selection checkboxes)

--ag-list-item-height.description: Height of items in lists (example of lists are dropdown select inputs and column menu set filters)

--ag-header-column-separator-display.description: Whether to display the header column separator - a vertical line that displays between every header cell
--ag-header-column-separator-display.type: CSS display value - `block` to show or `none` to hide

--ag-header-column-separator-height.description: Height of the header column separator. Percentage values are relative to the header height.

--ag-header-column-separator-width.description: Width of the header column separator

--ag-header-column-separator-color.description: Colour of the header column separator

--ag-header-column-resize-handle-display.description: Whether to show the header column resize handle - a vertical line that displays only between resizeable header columns, indicating where to drag in order to resize the column.
--ag-header-column-resize-handle-display.type: CSS display value - `block` to show or `none` to hide

--ag-header-column-resize-handle-height.description: Height of the header resize handle. Percentage values are relative to the header height.

--ag-header-column-resize-handle-width.description: Width of the header resize handle.

--ag-header-column-resize-handle-color.description: Colour of the header resize handle

--ag-column-select-indent-size.description: How much to indent child columns in the column tool panel relative to their parent

--ag-set-filter-indent-size.description: How much to indent child filter items in the Set Filter List relative to their parent

--ag-row-group-indent-size.description: How much to indent child rows in the grid relative to their parent row

--ag-filter-tool-panel-group-indent.description: How much to indent child columns in the filters tool panel relative to their parent

--ag-tab-min-width.description: Minimum width of a tabbed menu (usd in charts)

--ag-menu-min-width.description: Minimum width of a menu that is not tabbed

--ag-side-bar-panel-width.description: Width of the sidebar that contains the columns and filters tool panels

--ag-font-family.description: Font family used for all text

--ag-font-size.description: Default font size for text in the grid

--ag-icon-font-family.description: The [icon font](/custom-icons/) used by the grid.

--ag-card-radius.description: cards are elements that float above the UI

--ag-card-shadow.description: the default card shadow applies to simple cards like column drag indicators and text editors

--ag-popup-shadow.description: override the shadow for popups - cards that contain complex UI, like menus and charts
